intro: Hulemacanthus, commonly known as the spiny hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically large, heart-shaped, and covered with fine hairs. Hulemacanthus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
